fields.description:
Fully implement proof-of-concept work started in GUI-2057, which has implemented the batch-release and batch-disassociate operations, on the Elastic IPs landing page.

Implement the following multi-select operations:
- Disassociate IP Addresses from instance(s)
- Release IP Addresses to Cloud

attachment.filename: Elastic IP addresses - deselect row checkbox.png

fields.summary: Implement multi-select checkboxes on Elastic IPs landing page for release and disassociate operations

comments.body: [~alice]: Could you review the Elastic IP functional test sequence I added in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1729  and punt it back to me to implement a few more Elastic IP tests there?

[~kgill] The click method in our api has the wait_for_visible methods built in before it performs the click, so there is no need for adding "wait for visible" before "click" methods in the test code. Makes for a little less coding also.
Otherwise pages, dialogs and test sequence looks great!!!

[~alice]: Thanks for the feedback, especially on removing the extra "wait for visible" calls.  I've pushed another functional test that allocates and releases an elastic IP from the landing page (via the item's actions menu).  could you review the latest updates in PR 1729?
[~kgill] Looking good! I will add a verification step to release_eips_from_eip_lp guiec2 method, good to go into CI otherwise.

[~lnajjar], this is ready for your review (again) in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1729

Note that the indeterminate state for the select-all checkbox isn't working perfectly (i.e. it work if all checkboxes are checked individually and then one is selected, but it sometimes takes extra clicks to set the proper indeterminate state when the select-all checkbox is clicked first).  I've been unable to find a fix for the indeterminate state issues, so if those shortcomings are severe enough from a UX point of view we can remove setting the indeterminate state altogether.

You're right. After a few extra clicks on a checkbox, the select-all checkbox changes to indeterminate state.

For this page, when (1) the user selects on the select-all checkbox, then (2) selects off one of the row checkboxes, you could get away with changing the select-all checkbox to selected off.

We are going to need the indeterminate checkbox state to work for nested checkboxes. On example is when there are 10 or more resources in a category on the Metrics landing page (scroll down to "10 or more resources in a category - Expanded"): [https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Manage+Metrics+Landing]
[~lnajjar]: Back to you for UX review

Getting there, [~kgill].

I pulled the latest code for GUI-2272. When I selected on the select-all checkbox, the row checkbox changed to selected on. Cool. But when I selected-off the row checkbox, the select-all checkbox continued to stay checked on (see attachments).

Can you change the code so when (1) the select-all checkbox is selected on (the row checkboxes get selected on), and (2) a row checkbox is selected off, then (3) the select-all checkbox is selected off?

 !Elastic IP addresses - Select all.png|thumbnail!  !Elastic IP addresses - deselect row checkbox.png|thumbnail!
[~lnajjar]: Unfortunately we can't uncheck the select-all checkbox when an item is unselected since that would trigger all checkboxes to be unselected.  Back to you for UX review...

In the use case described above, users need the select-all checkbox to show either an indeterminate state or to be selected off. It sounds like neither is possible.

[~jloza], could you please weigh in here about user needs and code requirements?

If I understand this conversation correctly, [~kgill] you are saying if the following steps are taken the user can't unselect all using the single checkbox? 

1) select all
2) deselect a single row
3) unselect all

I would expect that to work. So that even if we can't support the indeterminate state (which surprises me since it's fairly standard) we should at least be able to toggle the All checkbox to select/deselect all regardless of the selection state of individual rows. 

I may be missing something but that would be the bext behavior if we can't support indeterminate state.

[~jloza]: No, checking the select-all checkbox selects all items, regardless of their individual state.  Unselecting the select-all checkbox unselects all checkboxes, regardless of their individual state.

What doesn't work is if I do the following...
1. select the select-all checkbox
2. Unselect an individual item
3. Expect the select-all checkbox to be unselected or in an indeterminate state

Unselecting an individual checkbox doesn't convert the select-all checkbox to unselected since unselecting the select-all checkbox causes all items to be unselected.  Meaning, if an item is unselected, we can't trigger the select-all checkbox to be unselected since that would cause all items to be unselected.

Hope that's clear.  I think this limitation is a relatively minor one, especially since many select-all implementations don't bother unselecting the select-all checkbox when one is unselected due to similar trigger issues.

OK, I see what you are saying now. That is less egregious than what I thought, if not ideal. I would really like to see the indeterminate state stuff fixed if we can (i hope there's a ticket for that so we can track the need) but it can definitely be viewed as non-MVP and not a roadblock for this ticket IMO.

Until [~kgill] figures out how to get the indeterminate state to work, users are left with the following situation:

1. User selects on the select-all checkbox (all row checkboxes are selected on)
2. User selects off one row checkbox (the select-all checkbox remains selected on)

This situation is likely to confuse users. The select-all checkbox is selected on but some rows are not selected.

[~jloza], what would you like to do with this ticket?
[~jloza]: I have filed GUI-2345 for the indeterminate state enhancement.
So, should we record GUI-2272 as being blocked by GUI-2345?

[~lnajjar]: Per Jenny's comment, "...it can definitely be viewed as non-MVP and not a roadblock for this ticket IMO."  I agree with Jenny, GUI-2345 should *not* be considered a blocker for GUI-2272 (and other multi-select tickets to come).
Right, we'll fix the indeterminate state stuff later if there's time.

Verified on Macintosh running Chrome Version 47.0.2526.80 (64-bit), Firefox 43.0, and Safari 9.0.2.

With the exception described above, UX review passed. Ready for code review.

I only got this for review, so sorry I didn't see look over the code sooner. We had discussed a more angular-ish approach when I was initially working on the metrics landing page and I though this branch had done something similar. Please see my comments in in the PR.
[~dkavanagh]: I'll see what I can do to make the code more consistent with the metrics landing page.  Could you point me to examples in your code?

Here are some points where I was able to greatly simply how checkboxes are set and read:
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/GUi-2302/eucaconsole/templates/cloudwatch/metrics.pt#L98
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/GUi-2302/eucaconsole/templates/cloudwatch/metrics.pt#L136
Not sure if the 2nd ref is completely useful to you.

If you need access to the checked items in your page's controller, here's one way to get the items (which is a reference to items on the landing page controller scope):
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/blob/GUi-2302/eucaconsole/static/js/pages/users.js#L116

I would hope the bulk of the select all functionality could be hidden in landingpage.js, macros.pt, perhaps similarly to expando (but that used a directive), so minimal content in the page template and javascript.
I'm sure [~ashamblin] and I would be happy to do a little design session if we want some group-think, or just to iterate on a new version to make it more angularious.

hi [~kgill], demo looked great! One small thing: more actions button should not appear magically but should always be there and available. Actions in the list may be disabled depending on selection, but the button itself should always be available. Also, please be sure this has a class on it that will also wit to be styled differently than the primary button. Thanks!!!

There may be more tweaks when this goes into UX review...you did a great job implementing this without wireframes!
[~jloza], here's another thought. Split button for "more actions" with most use being the primary?
[~dkavanagh] that is what I was hoping for as well, but [~lnajjar] is designing this one...you should talk to him.

[~jloza] and I spent some time working on the landing page button concept. 

We ended up with one main button for the major create action and a "More Actions" dropdown ("split?") button with the other actions. For example, see the Alarms Landing page ([https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Alarms+Landing]) and Manage Metrics Landing page ([https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Manage+Metrics+Landing]).

 !Alarms landing page.png|thumbnail!  !Metrics landing page.png|thumbnail!
[~dkavanagh]: I'm also using ng-model="item.selected" on the Elastic IPs page, per https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1729/files#diff-1899b0d0d1442597ff38fd125a2d0322R92

[~jloza]: Keep in mind that this went to UX review (to [~lnajjar]) a few days ago and was approved after we opened a separate ticket (GUI-2345) for the select-all checkbox state.  Once it passes code review we'll be unblocked implementing multi-select operations elsewhere.

[~jloza]: I pushed a change (in commit https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/b54cdabb913fa) to style the "More Actions" button as a secondary button, and the disabled state is also properly styled now.  Thanks for catching that!

[~kgill], Yes, I saw item.selected was set, but that value was never used anywhere else, rather checkedItems was maintained and used.
To demonstrate, i created another branch off GUI-2272. Here's the diff:
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/compare/GUI-2272...GUI-2272-dak?expand=1

What this shows is how to rely on angular filters to pull the selected state out of the item models. It also shows a good way to handle the select-all checkbox. By setting the model and using ng-click, we can separate user clicks from a programatic change, and avoid unchecking the box in code causing the ng-click method to be called.

To take this further, I would move the checkboxes into the macros.pt file, much like was done with expando. In that way, we can avoid duplicating that markup in each landing page. There may be other optimizations I haven't considered to ease the burden on each landing page.
Made changes suggested by [~dkavanagh] (thanks!).  Back to code review...
[~dkavanagh]: PR 1729 has passed Jenkins

[~kgill], can we chat today about the behavior? I have some concerns, specifically around the button for the actions not always displaying but only popping up when something is checked, whether the area that contains the button is fixed to prevent the user from not seeing it when the list is scrolled down so items can be checked, and the enablement/disablement of list items in the menu. We may need to rethink/redesign the UX around this functionality. 

Kicking back to to-do just so we can discuss this and it doesn't go to QA like this. 

CC: [~lnajjar]
The show/hide button behavior was changed to a disabled/enabled state based on item selection.  GUI-2359 has been opened to track the fixed placement of the More Actions button on user scroll.
